p: According to Ghasemi et al., differences between the number and amount of compounds identified for Iranian essential oil extracted by hydrodistillation and supercritical carbon dioxide were recorded [ 32]. The selectivity of the extraction was obvious for the SCCO 2 where three major components were predominant (α-pinene (29.9 to 38.6%), limonene (13.5 to 18.1%), and 1,8 cineole (23.3 to 29.1%)) in comparison with the conventional method (α-pinene (31.8%), 1,8-cineole (24.6%), limonene (14.8%), and linalol (8.3%)).
